website_summaries.verdict: The Canon EF-M 18-55mm f3.5-5.6 IS STM is sharper and better made than many 18-55mm lenses, but shows noticeable distortion at wider angles.

customer_reviews.title: [[[-_-]]]TM Practically Brand New!
customer_reviews.text: I was kind of sceptical about getting a used lens for my Canon EOS M50 Mirrorless Digital Camera 📸, but I was pleasantly surprised when I got it in my hands! One word... PERFECT!!! I couldn't resist the incredible price. If didn't buy it used, I would have thought it was brand new.
customer_reviews.author: BOOMBASH 😎

customer_reviews.title: This lens get some disdain but it's better than me and maybe better than a lot of ...
customer_reviews.text: Read the professional reviews. This lens get some disdain but it's better than me and maybe better than a lot of photographers. My biggest problem is holding the camera steady. For the EOS-M series the question is: Go with the faster EF-M 22mm prime, ...sharp if you can get it to focus, or, go with this more versatile EF-M 18-55mm that might be a little faster to focus and a little less sharp. You probably want both. I bought this one used-like-new from Electronics Basket and it is perfect. The price was right.
customer_reviews.author: morgansloan

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, versatile lens
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this lens used, with some reservations. Should not have had the worries as the lens is excellent and in excellent condition. Only reason for non-5 star rating is the weight of the lens is a bit heavy for just a "carry around lens," but that cannot be helped with higher quality build.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen D

customer_reviews.title: Speedy autofocus!
customer_reviews.text: After buying a used M3 and updating the firmware I was still unimpressed with the focus speed of my ef lenses. Decided to buy an M lens to give it a fair shot. This lens focuses super fast in comparison, has a sturdy metal body and is pretty darn sharp for a kit lens!
customer_reviews.author: Tberg

customer_reviews.title: Bargain of the year
customer_reviews.text: If you have an EOS M you probably got this lens with it. If not, if you got the 22mm instead, then get this lens now. The optics are typical Canon mid-range quality. This is not an L lens but has good sharpness and contrast. It appears to be well built, the lens is all metal (at least the touchable parts) and zooming is smooth. At the current pricing, it is an absolute steal.
customer_reviews.author: Shawade

customer_reviews.title: An excellent lens for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: I like pretty much everything about this lens. It's an excellent and fast "normal" and a significant addition to my camera gear.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: It's a good starter lens
customer_reviews.text: It's a good starter lens. If you have the money and you need a lens for vlogging or portraits I would go with the pancake lens 22 mm.
customer_reviews.author: dk3000

customer_reviews.title: good lil lens
customer_reviews.text: so i bought this on a wim the price was crazy so i took the chance turns out to be a good lil lens got it used would never know looks new good lens everyday shooting
customer_reviews.author: Myk

customer_reviews.title: Just a so-so lens
customer_reviews.text: The build quality of the lens is very good. The image quality is just so so I think. The fixed prime lens has better image quality so the zoom follows the usual image quality drop off when you go to a zoom. It is convenient to have, especially since there weren't other M lens available when I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Hasel

customer_reviews.title: great walk-around lens for outdoors
customer_reviews.text: great walk-around lens for outdoors. not quite as sharp as the 22mm lens but sharp enough. build quality is great and the price for used like new was a steal...didn't look used at all.
customer_reviews.author: gearheadskyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: I love this lens
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens!!! The EOS-M came with the prime lens, but THIS lens is the one I use ALL THE TIME. I rarely even use the prime lens anymore. This lens takes good photos whether close or far (within reason). Do yourself a favor and get this lens! You will be glad you did :)
customer_reviews.author: Joanna K.

customer_reviews.title: Great lens!
customer_reviews.text: Pictures are sharp and compare very well to pics from my full size L lens. Focusing is smooth and silent and are a great combination with the EOS M. The 22mm that came with it is nice as well but zooms are always handy when you don't want to carry your whole bag with you.
customer_reviews.author: Chew

customer_reviews.title: Good for every day use
customer_reviews.text: It takes okay picture with EOS M2, but not great. It's a practical lens for every day use. I really wish Canon makes 40-50mm prime lens for EOS M series. Right now, I have to use the adapter and that makes this small package less attractive.
customer_reviews.author: ComputerGeek

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price; lower quality than the camera's sensor
customer_reviews.text: A decent, low cost addition to my portable camera kit. It's a pleasure to use. It focuses plenty fast, feels well built and seems nicely matched to the EOS M body/weight. Whereas the 22mm pancake lens is so good that it lets the sensor provide all the quality it offers, this lens holds back the sensor a bit. And that's my only real gripe - it's just not as sharp as I'd like. Admittedly most of my shots have been toward the long end of the zoom and with smaller apertures for wide depth of field (on a tripod); maybe it does better at wider angles and with an aperture around f8-f13...
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for a kit lens.
customer_reviews.text: Not perfect but decent in daylight and low light on my M.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: perfect accessory to my eos 1 stock lens
customer_reviews.text: love this as addition to my eos 1. Great quality, reasonable price and exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.author: Boomswoosh

customer_reviews.title: EF-M 18-55mm lens
customer_reviews.text: An excellent lens and compact and light weight. It's very good for travel and the image quality is excellent. Check the review at: [...] It gives good detail.
customer_reviews.author: gary h

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Photo quality is great. Lens is light weight and decent size. I wish there was a smaller zoom, though. Overall, though, (combined with the firmware upgrade on the EOS-M), I now use my Canon EOS-M and this lens very often.
customer_reviews.author: J. Boyle

customer_reviews.title: Seems pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad lens if you can get it at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: WDB

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Great lens. Fast AF. Small and light weight. Fantastic bokeh. Great compliment for my 22mm lens. Also pairs nicely with my Canon 270EX ii flash.
customer_reviews.author: WK

customer_reviews.title: but this lens is great! super sharp and actually very fast focussing
customer_reviews.text: i know there is a newer version supposedly coming out, but this lens is great! super sharp and actually very fast focussing!
customer_reviews.author: skimlosangeles

customer_reviews.title: Love. This
customer_reviews.text: I.Love.This.Lens. This is pretty much my default lens whenever I start shooting.
customer_reviews.author: IronTank

customer_reviews.title: Produces nice pictures I did not even expected it to work ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered used, it came very clean. Produces nice pictures I did not even expected it to work so well. Good for video.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Fav lens
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens. Metal, fast. lightweight. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a camera for the EOS M camera.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Ford, USA

customer_reviews.title: Nice Lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a good lens for the EOS M. Optically very good. Not quite as nice as the 17-40L I have for my 7D, but close enough. The EOS M is so much more compact, that it travels with me on business trips that the 7D will not. With the 11-22, this lens covers most of what you need for street and landscape work. After processing, the images are fabulous. It is also good for movies. There is no focusing noise.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Great Build quality
customer_reviews.text: Great walking around lens. This paired with my 22mm prime is a great general set up. Lens feels well built and is sharp as would be expected with a canon product.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon moore

customer_reviews.title: lens
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. And it is as expected. I would recommend the lens if you don't have it yet. The dealer was good as well.
customer_reviews.author: Elenavl

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great little lens! Well made, very solid feel and function.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Darneille

customer_reviews.title: Great Walk Around Lens
customer_reviews.text: When the EOS M cae out I purchased it immediately. It's smaller then a lot of the point and shoot cameras available, and the quality of the pictures are great. When I bought my camera it only came with the 22m lens. It's a fast and nice lens, but for every day use, I needed a zoom. The range is great, although it would have been nice to see it go beyond 100mm. Its relatively sdmall and fits in my camera bag for the EOS M. Don't forget to buy the 52mm UV filter to protect it.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley Joe Wynman

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Sharp lens for the EOS M system. Shame about the slow focusing of the Canon EOS M though. I use it with the 22mm pancake.
customer_reviews.author: Tan Zexun

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love the built quality, the speed and the price
customer_reviews.author: Jerome

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens so far
customer_reviews.text: I found this lens to be quite sharp and well made, and it focuses fine on the eos-m. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Snow

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT LENS FOR GENERAL PHOTOGRAPHY
customer_reviews.text: It is a great lens for general photography. Lightweight, compact and fast autofocus. Takes great picture but given that it is a zoom lens with the usual restrictive apertures, we cannot expect prime lens performance.
customer_reviews.author: Monack

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Use your money for the EF 40mm f/2.8 instead
customer_reviews.text: Meh. Compared to the EF-M 22mm pancake, this thing's contrast, sharpness, and depth of field is average at best. It basically does a half-decent job at the different focal lengths, but nothing well. Would recommend the EF 50mm f/1.8 or EF 40mm f/2.8 instead - same price range, better MTF curves, better apertures and the things that come with it (low light ability, shallow depth of field, faster shutter speeds). Returned it after 1 week.
customer_reviews.author: Northampton

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Good lens, but of course, slightly slow for a kit lens. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas R. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far
customer_reviews.text: I received this lens as a gift for Christmas to go with my eos m. It's really nice to have both lenses! Pictures are turning out great, I have no complaints. Lens was packaged carefully and arrived on time. Overall, I would recommend this seller!
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Great lens, tack sharp
customer_reviews.text: This lens is very sharp on my Eos M camera. I like it more than the pictures from my 22mm. Good range, fast focusing. Don't believe the negative comments about the Eos M. With this lens you will get some great shots.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this lens bundled with the camera...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the camera with the fixed focal length lens which was silly of me. i ended up having to buy this lens separate.
customer_reviews.author: bcoggs

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: This lens autofocuses faster than the 22mm STM pancake, but even with the new firmware update, the EOS-M is too slow for my needs (toddler). I found myself carrying around the camera with the 22mm simply because it could fit in my pocket, whereas this 18-55mm, which has very good build quality, was just too big. The EOS M isn't a DSLR replacement, it's a point-and-shoot replacement for DSLR owners and makes a great 2nd camera, but unless you carry it on a strap or have a purse/fannypack, it's not portable enough.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Lowthorp

customer_reviews.title: Great every day lens
customer_reviews.text: Great to have. Released a few year ago and the new EF-M 15–45mm f/3.5–6.3 IS STM is common. However, this lens is slightly longer, so it's like 24–88mm on a full-frame camera. It's light and reasonably priced. It does not retract like the 15-45mm, however. It has a macro focusing down to 0.25 meters.
customer_reviews.author: John Drake

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: I like this lens it came with my m50 and I have taken some great pictures with it
customer_reviews.author: COOP

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sharpness and handling - watch out for light sources
customer_reviews.text: All in all, I am very favorably impressed by the 18-55 STM. It is sharper and smaller than the ef-s 18-55 Canon offerings. It's also sharper than Sony's NEX 18-55 (I've owned all of these). It focuses quickly and silently. I had no trouble with focus noises in a couple of quick videos I did of my son playing basketball. The only apparent drawback of this lens is that it will flare if there is a direct light source in or near the frame (especially the sun). I know it is a common complaint about Canon, but they really should have included a hood with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Its easy portability makes it a lens for every where. I guess I needed as a needed the G 15.
customer_reviews.author: Ortodontic

product_meta.title: Canon EF-M 18-55mm f3.5-5.6 Image Stabilization STM Compact System Lens
product_meta.description:
Style:BaseDesigned for use with the EOS M Compact Systems Digital Camera, the new EF-M 18–55mm f/3.5–5.6 IS STM lens offers a compact and lightweight design for easy portability. Its image stabilization system provides up to four equivalent stops of shake correction to deliver stunning video and photos without blur. A seven-blade circular aperture helps create beautiful, soft backgrounds for expressive video and portraits!

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 


The EF-M 18–55mm f/3.5–5.6 IS STM has three aspheric lens elements that help reduce aberration throughout the zoom range to provide high resolution and high contrast for superb image quality. Optimized lens placement and coatings ensure minimized ghosting and flare. This lens also supports the EOS M Digital Camera’s Movie Servo AF function for smooth and quiet continuous autofocus during video shooting by utilizing a stepping motor; it even has Dynamic IS to provide the image stabilization needed while recording video when walking (in movie shooting mode). 

EF-M 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 IS STM WIDE
EF-M 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 IS STM TELE




Specifications EF-M 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 IS STM Lens 

Focal Length & Maximum Aperture
18–55mm, 1:3.5–5.6
Lens Construction
13 elements in 11 groups 
Diagonal Angle of View
74°20′ – 27°50′
Focus Adjustment
Inner Focusing System
Closest Focusing Distance
0.82 ft. / 0.25m 
Zoom System
Rotating Type
Filter Size
52mm
Max. Diameter x Length, Weight
2.4 x 2.4 inch, 7.4 oz. / 60.9 x 61.0mm, 210g
feature_bullets: Standard zoom lens for Canon EOS M digital camera with image stabilization for up to four eqiuvalent stops of shake correctoin
Supports continuous AF during video shooting
Circular aperture (7 blades) for soft backgrounds
Maximum magnification of 0.25x at the telephoto end
Minimum focusing distance: 9.8 in./0.25m (full zoom range)
